DataElement.preferredName: Person First Meal Assessment Time Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The time related to a person's first meal.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Information related to a person's first meal.

Property.preferredDefinition: Preceding all others in time or space or degree.:Any of the occasions for eating food that occur by custom or habit at more or less fixed times.:Having determined the value, significance, or extent of.

Concepts.definition: Preceding all others in time or space or degree.
Any of the occasions for eating food that occur by custom or habit at more or less fixed times.
The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

DataElementConcept.origin: NCCTG CRF:North Central Cancer Treatment Group Case Report Form
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Changed from CTEP to Alliance for by script Fri Oct 25 15:25:44 EDT 2013

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A value that represents the measured or measurable period during which an action, process, or condition exists or continues.  [Explanatory comment:  The preferred exchange format for Time is hhmmss.uuuu[+|-]ZZzz where hh is an Hour with numbers between 00 and 23, (00 being  midnight and 12 being noon), mm is a Minute with are numbers between 00 and 59, ss is Seconds with numbers between 00 and 59, uuuu is optional Fractional Seconds with integers (0 to 9) in any position, and [+|-]ZZzz is the optional  difference in hours (ZZ - integers +14 to -13) and minutes (zz - values 0 to 59) from the Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). Full Time would contain all three elements in the format hhmmss. Partial Time may be expressed by using the data elements for Hour, Minute, or Second. The display format for Time information is determined by programmatic requirements.]

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The information contained in a data field.

Concepts.definition: The information contained in a data field. It may represent a numeric quantity, a textual characterization, a date or time measurement, or some other state, depending on the nature of the attribute.
